topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Applying the Horizon Dynamic Password Patch

body.section:
The HPE Helion OpenStack cloud deployment creates a default password to log into the Horizon interface.
You can deploy a patch to configure the installer to generate a dynamic user name and password for the Horizon interface. The user name and password can be retrieved from a configuration file. You should have downloaded the patch files in the Prerequisites.
Note: You need the Ubuntu patch utility installed on the lifecycle manager host. If you do not have the utility installed, use the following command:apt-get install patch
To apply the patch:
Log into the lifecycle manager host.
Copy the horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz to the ~/patch_cghelion1.1 directory. cp horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz ~/patch_cghelion1.1
Use the following command to extract the horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz: tar -zxvf horizon_web_patch_1.1.tar.gz

section.title: Apply the patch to the configuration processor

ol.li: Change to the following directory: cd ~/kenobi-configuration-processor

Execute the following command to perform a dry-run of the patch to verify: patch -p1 --dry-run < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/horizon_web_patch_1.1.patch
The output appears similar to the following:checking file Data/Site/services/keystone.json

Execute the following command to apply the patch:patch -p1 < ~/patch_cghelion1.1/horizon_web_patch_1.1.patch
The output appears similar to the following:patching file Data/Site/services/keystone.json

section.title: Synchronize the patch files to the environment

ol.li: Execute the following command to synch the patch file:./hlm_prepare-env.sh

body.section:
Retrieve the Horizon passwordAfter the patch is implemented and the HP Helion OpenStack cloud is deployed, you and retrieve the random password from the stackrc file.
SSH to any controller in the non-KVM region: ssh cghelion@<ip-address>
Change to the /root/ directory: sudo -i
Open the stackrc file vi stackrc
Locate the export OS_PASSWORD= field. The value is the Horizon password.
body.p: Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
